total_grammar_preinter1.question: The mausoleum is ________ by Thien Thu mountain, two towering columns and a vast expanse of water.
Put plants ________ a window so that they will get enough light.
total_grammar_preinter1.explain: - Next to (proposition): very close to someone or something, with nothing in between.

total_grammar_preinter1.question: Employers often require that candidates have not only a degree ________.
Richard Nixon had been a lawyer and ________ before he entered politics.
total_grammar_preinter1.a: served in the Navy as an officer
total_grammar_preinter1.c: the Navy had him as an officer
total_grammar_preinter1.d: did service in the Navy as an officer
total_grammar_preinter1.explain: - Parallel structure: structure before and after "and" must be nouns of careers

total_grammar_preinter1.question: If one of the participants in a conversation wonders ________ no real communication has taken place.
total_grammar_preinter1.c: what did the other person say
total_grammar_preinter1.d: what was the other person saying
total_grammar_preinter1.explain: - Narrative sentence: S + V + O (what the other person said)

total_grammar_preinter1.question: The salary of a bus driver is much higher ________.
total_grammar_preinter1.a: in comparison with the salary of a teacher
total_grammar_preinter1.explain: - We use the comparative form of short adjective (high)

total_grammar_preinter1.question: Professional people expect ________ when it is necessary to cancel an appointment.
total_grammar_preinter1.explain: - Expect somebody to do something = want somebody to do something

total_grammar_preinter1.question: Sedimentary rocks are formed below the surface of the earth ________ very high temperatures and pressures.
total_grammar_preinter1.explain:
- What/where/ which... can be use as a relative pronoun. Relative pronouns introduce relative clauses, which are a type of dependent clause. 
- Dependent clause followed by relative pronoun (who/whom/which/where...) is narrative sentence: S + V + O.

total_grammar_preinter1.question: Farmers look forward to ________ every summer.
total_grammar_preinter1.c: be participating in the county fairs
total_grammar_preinter1.d: have participated in the county fairs

total_grammar_preinter1.question: Clipper ships were the swiftest sailing ships that ________ to sea and the most beautiful.
total_grammar_preinter1.explain:
- Structure: To be + adv (ever, never, often, sometimes...). + PII
- Irregular Verb: Put- Put- Put.

total_grammar_preinter2.question: The ships had their days of ________ in the 1840s and 1850s.
Tea loses its flavor quickly ________ in the hold of a vessel.
total_grammar_preinter2.explain:
- What/where/ which... can be use as a relative pronoun. Relative pronouns introduce relative clauses, which are a type of dependent clause. 
- Dependent clause followed by relative pronoun (who/whom/which/where...) is narrative sentence: S + V + O.

total_grammar_preinter2.question: Earl was one of the first American artists ________ landscapes.
total_grammar_preinter2.explain: - Structure: the first, the second (time/person...) to do sth.

total_grammar_preinter2.question: The crime rate has continued to rise in American cities despite efforts on the part of both government and private citizens to curb ________.
In 1778, he ________ to London to study with Benjamin West for four years.
total_grammar_preinter2.explain: - Simple past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (in 1778).

total_grammar_preinter2.question: No one has been able to satisfactorily explain how or ________ the Moon sporadically sparks.
total_grammar_preinter2.explain: - In the blank, we need a "reason"- why.

total_grammar_preinter2.question: The basic fiber-optics system is called a fiberscope, ________ consists of two bundles of fibers.
total_grammar_preinter2.explain: - Which: used, after a comma in writing, to add more information about the thing, situation, or event you have just mentioned.

total_grammar_preinter2.question: Physicians can look into the lungs, heart and other areas that were formerly ________ to them.
total_grammar_preinter2.explain: - Inaccessible(adj): difficult or impossible to reach

total_grammar_preinter2.question: ________ his highly individual conceptions of music and chaos, John Cage became a leading figure in avant-garde music.
Sanford Meisner ________ the Neighborhood Playhouse in New York City.

total_grammar_preinter3.question: Experiments in the sonic imaging of moving objects ________ in both the United States and Europe well before the Second World War.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain: - The Past Perfect expresses the idea that something occurred before another action in the past. It can also show that something happened before a specific time in the past (before the Second World War).

total_grammar_preinter3.question: ________ billions and billions of stars exist in the vast space beyond our Milky Way galaxy.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain:
- Active: People/ They + think/ say/ suppose/ believe/ consider/ report ... + THAT + clause. 
- Passive : IT'S + thought/ said/ supposed/ believed/ considered/ reported ... + THAT + clause.

total_grammar_preinter3.question: ________ gene-bearing bodies within the nuclei of living organisms.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- This sentence is a single clause- doesn't need a relative pronoun (who/whom/which...).

total_grammar_preinter3.question: Abner Doubleday, ________, was credited with the invention of baseball in 1839.
total_grammar_preinter3.a: who become a Union army general
total_grammar_preinter3.b: which became a Union army general
total_grammar_preinter3.c: who were a Union army general
total_grammar_preinter3.explain:
- Use a pair of commas in the middle of a sentence to set off clauses, phrases, and words that are not essential to the meaning of the sentence. 
- Do not use commas to set off essential elements of the sentence, such as clauses beginning with that (relative clauses).

total_grammar_preinter3.question: ________ photosynthesis were to stop, life would disappear from the planet Earth relatively quickly.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain: - Conditional sentence type 2: If + past simple, S + would/should + V.

total_grammar_preinter3.question: Each fiber in the bundle ________ only a tiny fraction of the total image.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain:
- Simple present tense: express general fact. 
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- Subject (Each fiber in the bundle) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter3.question: Antonio Gaudi, architect of Barcelona's Holy Family Church, died before seeing ________ the structure.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain:
- See something. 
- Subject is " Antonio Gaudi"- their is not correct.

total_grammar_preinter3.question: This is the factory ________ at work.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain:
- What/where/ which... can be use as a relative pronoun. Relative pronouns introduce relative clauses, which are a type of dependent clause. 
- Dependent clause followed by relative pronoun (who/whom/which/where...) is narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- Where= in which.

total_grammar_preinter3.question: America's first globe maker was James Wilson, who ________ and blacksmith in his earlier life.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain:
- What/where/ which... can be use as a relative pronoun. Relative pronouns introduce relative clauses, which are a type of dependent clause. 
- Dependent clause followed by relative pronoun (who/whom/which/where...) is narrative sentence: S + V + O.

total_grammar_preinter3.question: Napoleon ________ the West Indian island of Santo Domingo in 1801.
total_grammar_preinter3.explain: - Simple past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (in 1801).

total_grammar_preinter4.question: Modern industrial methods have supplanted individual crafts, ________ stone carvers, coopers, and cobblers virtually extinct.
Not only knowledge and skills, but also attitudes ________ in school for students' future adjustment to society.
total_grammar_preinter4.explain:
- Need + to Verb. 
- Passive voice: need to be + PP. 
- This sentence is a single clause- doesn't need a relative pronoun (who/whom/which...).

total_grammar_preinter4.question: On Mercator's maps, the far northern and southern polar regions are ________.
total_grammar_preinter4.explain: - Adverbs go before past participles that they modify

total_grammar_preinter4.question: On the slope of Long's Peak in Colorado ________ the ruin of a gigantic tree.
total_grammar_preinter4.explain: - We use inversion with adverbial expressions of place at the beginning

total_grammar_preinter4.question: ________ in Shanghai than in any other city in China.
The earth spins on its axis and ________ 23 hours, 56 minutes and 4.09 seconds for one complete rotation.
________ on the environment for the gratification of its needs.
total_grammar_preinter4.explain: - Narrative sentence: S + V + O. (we need the subject and the verb to make a complete sentence)

total_grammar_preinter4.question: Of Charles Dickens' many novels, expectations perhaps ________ to many readers.
total_grammar_preinter4.explain: - We use the superlative form of long adjective satisfying

total_grammar_preinter4.question: ________, the nation's capital remained in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
total_grammar_preinter4.c: While Washington, D.C., was being designed
total_grammar_preinter4.explain:
- Passive voice: used when you want to emphasize the person or thing acted on. 
- While: is complemented by a clause with an activity that occurs during or at the same time as another activity.

total_grammar_preinter4.question: Children learn primarily by ________ the world around them.
total_grammar_preinter4.explain: - A gerund goes after a preposition (by + V-ing)

total_grammar_preinter5.question: It is earth's gravity that ________ people their weight.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain:
- Simple present tense. 
- That= gravity (singular)= give- gives.

total_grammar_preinter5.question: Generally speaking, people should have ________ as their desires will allow.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain: - Comparison of Equality: as + adj/ adv+ as.

total_grammar_preinter5.question: A dolphin six ________ length can move as fast as most ships.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain:
- Feet is plural of "foot".
- Structure: number + measurement unit+ in length.

total_grammar_preinter5.question: With new technology, cameras can take pictures of underwater valleys ________ color.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain: - In (full) colour: a television programme, film, or photograph that is in colour contains colours such as red, green, and blue rather than just black and white.

total_grammar_preinter5.question: ________ the fifth largest among the nine planets that make up our solar system.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain:
- Simple present tense: S + V (normal Verb/ to be) + O. 
- "That the Earth is": That is unnecessary.

total_grammar_preinter5.question: In mathematics, a variable is a symbol ________ some element of a set.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain: - That(pronoun): used as a subject of the relative clause

total_grammar_preinter5.question: ________ actress's life is in many ways unlike that of other women.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain: - An: used instead of a when the next word begins with a vowel sound

total_grammar_preinter5.question: About 20 miles from Boston, ________ a little town named Concord that has a rich history.
total_grammar_preinter5.explain: - There is + a/ an + countable noun

total_grammar_preinter5.question: An advisor to both Franklin Delano Roosevelt and Harry Truman, ________ of Bethune Cookman College.
total_grammar_preinter5.a: Dr. Mary Mcleod Bethune was the founder
total_grammar_preinter5.b: Dr. Mary Mcleod Bethune, who was the founder
total_grammar_preinter5.c: the founder was Dr. Mary Mcleod Bethune
total_grammar_preinter5.d: did the founder Dr. Mary Mcleod Bethune
total_grammar_preinter5.explain: - "An advisor to both Franklin Delano Roosevelt and Harry Truman" is an introductory phrases but doesn't have particular subject= right after comma we need a subject.

total_grammar_preinter5.question: Warmth, moisture, and oxygen are three necessary requirements ________ most seedlings.

total_grammar_preinter6.question: They share the housework ________ between them.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain: - "Share" is normal verb- followed by an adverb.

total_grammar_preinter6.question: A well-known large natural lake is Lake Tahoe, ________ straddles the California-Nevada border.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain: - Which (pronoun): used as the subject in the non-defining relative clause

total_grammar_preinter6.question: Before ________, they used horse-drawn wooden carts.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain:
- They= farmers- subject in first clause must be "farmers". 
- Simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter6.question: Tuna, ________, may weigh up to 1,000 pounds.
total_grammar_preinter6.b: can be giants of the sea
total_grammar_preinter6.explain: - Use a pair of commas in the middle of a sentence to set off clauses, phrases, and words that are not essential to the meaning of the sentence.

total_grammar_preinter6.question: Physical fitness exercises can cause injuries ________ the participants are not careful.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain: - This is a Conditional Sentence type 1

total_grammar_preinter6.question: Total weight of all the ants in the world is much greater than ________.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain:
- Thing to compare must be equal- person-person; object-object... 
- Thing to compare in this case is " total weight of" - that of.

total_grammar_preinter6.question: ________ for overall health.
total_grammar_preinter6.a: Extra fiber in one's diet is helpful
total_grammar_preinter6.b: Extra fiber is one's helpful diet
total_grammar_preinter6.c: Helpful one's diet is extra fiber
total_grammar_preinter6.d: One's diet is helpful in extra fiber
total_grammar_preinter6.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- Subject: Extra fiber in one's diet.

total_grammar_preinter6.question: Elephants scratch themselves with sticks ________.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain: - We use past participle to shorten the relative clause (passive meaning)

total_grammar_preinter6.question: Van Gogh's "Sunflowers" ________ 39.9 million, three times the previous record.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain:
- Simple past tense. 
- Once + Verb in past form: in the past, at a time that is not stated.

total_grammar_preinter6.question: Some monkeys, ________, use their tails in a way similar to a hand.
total_grammar_preinter6.explain:
- Like + noun: similar to something else, or happening in the same way. 
- When the sentence is separated by a pair of commas in the middle of a sentence, words lie between these two commas are not essential to the meaning of the sentence and they don't affect sentence structure.

total_grammar_preinter7.question: Black, red, and even bright pink diamonds ________.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain: - Present perfect + passive voice: S + have/has + (adv)+ been + PP.

total_grammar_preinter7.question: Between the California Coast Range and the Sierra Nevada ________.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain: - We use the inversion with adverbial expression of place

total_grammar_preinter7.question: It is gravity ________ objects toward the earth.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain: - We use that (pronoun) as the subject in the relative clause

total_grammar_preinter7.question: ________ their territories but rather than fight, they howl.
________ strength of 70 horses, a forklift toils all day long in a warehouse lifting great weights.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain: - With + Noun: to say what tool you use to do something.

total_grammar_preinter7.question: The growth of two-income families in the United States ________ of people moving to a new social class.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain:
- Present perfect tense: We often use the Present Perfect to talk about change that has happened over a period of time. 
- Result in something: To make sth happen.

total_grammar_preinter7.question: Using a globe can be ________ it is educational.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain: - Comparison of Equality: as + adj/ adv+ as.

total_grammar_preinter7.question: Each mediocre book we read means one less great book that we would otherwise have a chance ________.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain: - Have a chance to do sth.

total_grammar_preinter7.question: Most accidents in the home can be prevented by ________ elimination of hazards.
________ problems in sailing in tropical seas is the coral reefs.
total_grammar_preinter7.explain: - Structure: one of + superlative preposition + plural noun.

total_grammar_preinter8.question: The strongest dump trucks work in rock quarries, ________ tons of rocks and soil at one time.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain: - In rock quarries: implies the place - where.

total_grammar_preinter8.question: Alice Freeman, ________ to head Wellesley College at age 27, is one of the youngest college presidents in history.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain:
- Simple past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (at age 27). 
- Alice Freeman: implies person- who.

total_grammar_preinter8.question: Helen Keller lost both her sight and hearing after a severe illness ________.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain:
- Refer to age: at the age of + number/ to be + number + year(s)/month(s) old. 
- When/ while + S+ V + O

total_grammar_preinter8.question: Because aluminum is lighter and cheaper ________, it is frequently used for high-tension power transmission.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain: - We use the comparative form of short adjectives

total_grammar_preinter8.question: It is only recently that ballets have been based on themes ________ American life.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain:
- A participle is a verb form which can be used as an adjective to describe a noun. 
+ When the present participle (-ing from) is used, the noun it describes is (or was) the performer of the activity named by the participle. 
+ When the past participle (-ed, -en form) is used, the noun it describes is (or was) acted upon.

total_grammar_preinter8.question: Poison oak generates irritating poisons ________ even if people merely brush against the plants.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain: - That : That introduces essential clauses while "which, what" introduces nonessential clauses.

total_grammar_preinter8.question: ________ ants live in colonies, keep farms, go to war, carry off slaves, and have a society somewhat like human beings.
total_grammar_preinter8.a: Studies of ant life show that
total_grammar_preinter8.d: That the studies of ant life

total_grammar_preinter8.question: Generic medications are just as ________, and much less expensive.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain: - Comparison of Equality: as + adj/ adv+ as.

total_grammar_preinter8.question: ________ is no way to tell the exact number of heroin addicts in the United States.
total_grammar_preinter8.explain: - There is no way to do something

total_grammar_preinter8.question: Ernest Hemingway is ________ of modern fiction.
total_grammar_preinter8.c: who is one of the molders
total_grammar_preinter8.d: the molders who is the one
total_grammar_preinter8.explain: - One of the (superlative adj)+ plural noun.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: ________ occasions for congratulations.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain: - Passive voice: S + TO BE + PP.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: Forty-niners ________ to California for gold in 1848.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain: - Simple past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (in 1848).

total_grammar_preinter9.question: In order for people to work together effectively, they need ________ Each other's needs.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain:
- Need to be/to Verb. 
- Sensitive to sth.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: It is good form to use the name of the person ________.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain:
Relative clause: 
+ Who: replaces person in subject. 
+ Whom: replaces person in object. 
+ Which: replaces for things. 
- This case, replaced person is object- whom, however, whom is omitted.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: ________ the promotion of health and to helping people avoid injury and disease.
total_grammar_preinter9.c: Committed to the Red Cross is
total_grammar_preinter9.d: The Red Cross is committed to
total_grammar_preinter9.explain:
- To be committed to do sth/sth.
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O.
- "the promotion of health and to helping people avoid injury and disease" is object- in ............. must be: S +V.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: People usually can get a sufficient amount of the calcium their bodies ________ from the food they consume.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- People: plural subject- need.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: It is possible ________ may assist some trees in saving water in the winter.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain: - Structure: It's adj/ noun that+ clause.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: Hollywood, the heart of America's motion picture industry, ________ of Los Angeles a century ago.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- Use a pair of commas in the middle of a sentence to set off clauses, phrases, and words that are not essential to the meaning of the sentence= main clause is: Hollywood + S + O (was only a quiet suburb).

total_grammar_preinter9.question: Kitchen appliances called blenders became ________ in the 1930s, when Stephen J. Poplawski developed a machine that excelled at making his favorite drink.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain: - Get/become established: to start feeling happy, confident, and successful in a new job or place.

total_grammar_preinter9.question: Built at the beginning of the century, the Library of Congress houses one of the largest ________ collections of books in the world.
total_grammar_preinter9.explain:
- Parallel structure: structure before and after "and" must be parallel. 
Superlative form of adjective/adverb: 
+ Short adj: The + adj/adv +est. 
+ Long adj: The + most + adj/adv.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: In the preparation of fibrous material for production uses, stiff woody fibers from plants ________ fibers from animal sources.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Comparative of adj: 
+ Short adj: Adj + er + than 
+ Long adj: More + adj + than 
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- S: stiff woody fibers from plants.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: Partnership is an association of two or more individuals who ________ together to develop a business.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Who (= individuals): is relative pronoun for subject. 
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: Chosen as the nation's capital at the end of the American Civil War, ________ a city of over a million people.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- Use a pair of commas in the middle of a sentence to set off clauses, phrases, and words that are not essential to the meaning of the sentence.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: Within an area of only 100 miles, Death Valley sinks to 282 feet below sea level while Mount Whitney ________ to a height of 14,494 feet.
The cosmopolitan flavor of San Francisco is enhanced by ________ shops and restaurants.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Adjective is used to modify noun and stands before noun. 
- shops and restaurants is plural- "an" is not correct.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: ________ that increasing numbers of compact-disc players will be bought by consumers in the years to come.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Active: People/ They + think/ say/ suppose/ believe/ consider/ report ... + THAT + clause. 
- Passive : IT'S + thought/ said/ supposed/ believed/ considered/ reported ... + THAT + clause.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: Birds all over the world ________ in distances up to thousands of miles.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Simple present tense: express general fact. 
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: Cellulose, which ________ for making paper, can be found in all plants.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Passive voice: be + PP. 
- Cellulose: is singular-is used.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: ________, human beings have relatively constant body temperature.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
- Alike is adverb or subject. 
- Like: can be used as conjunction.

total_grammar_preinter10.question: So far there is no vaccine ________ in sight for the common cold.
total_grammar_preinter10.explain:
-Parallel structure: structure before and after "or" must be parallel. 
Vaccine is noun- word after "or" must be noun.

total_grammar_preinter11.question: The Louisiana Territory, an area ________ the size of France, was bought by the United States from France for 15,000,000 in 1803.
Despite claims that filters and low-tar tobacco make smoking somewhat safer, in fact they only marginally reduce, ________ eliminate the hazards.
total_grammar_preinter11.explain:
- No goes with nouns.
- Not goes with verbs. 
- None of + noun. 
- Nor: used after a negative statement in order to introduce another negative statement containing a similar kind of information.

total_grammar_preinter11.question: ________ many of the designs for the new capital were considered lost forever, Benjamin Banneker helped reproduce the original plans.
total_grammar_preinter11.explain:
- When: at or during the time that something happens.
+ When + Clause; During + period.

total_grammar_preinter11.question: Few natural elements exist in ________ that they are rarely seen in their natural environments.
total_grammar_preinter11.explain:
- So/such...that: used when emphasizing the degree or amount of something by saying what the result is. 
- Such + Noun phrase (adj + noun). 
- So + adj.

total_grammar_preinter11.question: Generally speaking, every person ________ the potential to be a teacher, to some extent.
total_grammar_preinter11.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- S (every person) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter11.question: ________ business, a merger is a combination of two or more corporations under one management.
________ of commodities by air began in the 1920s at the same time as airmail service.
total_grammar_preinter11.explain:
- The + definite noun. 
- Shipping: the delivery of goods, especially by ship. 
- Ship: used to deliver good.

total_grammar_preinter11.question: Jan Malzeliger's invention, the shoe-lasting machine, ________ production but it also cut the cost of shoe production by half.
Jellyfish are probably ________ on Earth.
total_grammar_preinter11.explain:
- Superlative form of adjective/adverb: 
+ Short adj: The + adj/adv +est. 
+ Long adj: The + most + adj/adv.

total_grammar_preinter12.question: In the United States ________ is the most concentrated is New Orleans.
total_grammar_preinter12.d: where the French influence the city
total_grammar_preinter12.explain:
- Relative pronoun must stand after the noun/pronoun it replaces.
- Where= the city.

total_grammar_preinter12.question: A log grabber has a long arm ________, which stretches out to pick up logs.
total_grammar_preinter12.explain: - We use past participle to shorten the clause

total_grammar_preinter12.question: A home computer ________ an opportunity for convenient and efficient work at home.
total_grammar_preinter12.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O. 
- S (A home computer) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter12.question: Eli Whitney's milling machine remained unchanged for a century and a half because ________ was so efficient.
Some of the rainwater from clouds evaporates before ________.
Once an offending allergen has been identified ________ tests, it is possible for the doctor to give specific desensitizing injections.
total_grammar_preinter12.explain: - By means of something: using a particular method or system.

total_grammar_preinter12.question: Sometimes ________ wears people out and is worse than the lack of sleep itself.
total_grammar_preinter12.explain:
- Narrative sentence: S + V + O = we need a Subject in ...
- The desire to sleep: plays as a noun phrase.

total_grammar_preinter12.question: Although dissimilar in almost every other respect, birds and insects have both evolved efficient ________ capabilities.
total_grammar_preinter12.explain: - Efficient ............. capabilities is a noun phrase- we need an adj or a noun in ....

total_grammar_preinter12.question: The wheel, ________ has remained important for 4,000 years, is one of mankind's first inventions.
total_grammar_preinter12.explain:
- Which: is a relative pronoun used to replace for thing (When: time; how: manner). 
- About + Noun/ verb-ing.

total_grammar_preinter12.question: ________ children master the basics, advanced development becomes easier.
total_grammar_preinter12.explain: - Once (conj): from the time when something happens.

total_grammar_preinter13.question: ________ there is a close correlation between stress and illness.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain: - People/ They + think/ say/ suppose/ believe/ consider/ report ... + (THAT )+ clause.

total_grammar_preinter13.question: ________ is often used in soups and sauces.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain: - Use a pair of commas in the middle of a sentence to set off clauses, phrases, and words that are not essential to the meaning of the sentence.

total_grammar_preinter13.question: Perspiration increases ________ vigorous exercise or hot weather.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain:
- When + Clause; at the time + that/clause. 
- During + period. 
- For: implies purpose.

total_grammar_preinter13.question: Goddard developed the first rocket to fly faster ________.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain:
- Comparative of adj: 
+ Short adj: Adj + er + than. 
+ Long adj: More + adj + than. 
- Fly: is normal verb- "is" is not correct (it should be "to do").

total_grammar_preinter13.question: Even if the unemployment rate ________ sharply, the drop may still be temporary.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain: - We use the conditional sentence type I

total_grammar_preinter13.question: Studies indicate ________ collecting art today than ever before.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain:
- Indicate/believe ...that. 
- We use the comparative form of short adjectives much

total_grammar_preinter13.question: Thieu Tri was a ________ poet who would pen a verse or two at a moment's notice.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain:
- A ............... poet is a noun phrase- we need an adj or a noun in .... 
- In this case, we should use adj.

total_grammar_preinter13.question: I've been to the theater ________ of times.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain:
- Much/ a little: uncountable noun. 
- Few/a few/many: countable noun.

total_grammar_preinter13.question: But ________ of the plays I've seen are modern.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain:
- Much / a little: uncountable noun. 
- Few/a few/many: countable noun. 
- Most of: nearly all of the people or things in a group, or nearly all of something. 
- In this case " most" is more suitable than "many" because speaker wants to express "nearly all of the plays".

total_grammar_preinter13.question: When I studied Shakespeare, I thought his plays were ________ boring.
total_grammar_preinter13.explain:
- A great deal of/ many/few+ noun.
- Much + noun/adj. 
- Much / a little/ : uncountable noun/ adj. 
- A great deal of + uncountable noun. 
- Few/a few/many: countable noun.

total_grammar_preinter14.question: ________ of Shakespeare's plays are about history.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain:
- Much / a little: uncountable noun. 
- Few/a few/many: countable noun. 
- "A few" not "a few of".

total_grammar_preinter14.question: They spent ________ time studying Victorian literature.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain:
- Much/ a little: uncountable noun. 
- Few/a few/many/a large number of: countable noun.

total_grammar_preinter14.question: ________ popular expressions in our language have interesting background.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain:
- Much/ a little: uncountable noun. 
- Few/a few/many/a large number of: countable noun.

total_grammar_preinter14.question: At the beginning everybody spoke English very quickly and I couldn't understand ________. But after ________ days, it is easier and ________ things I had learnt came back to me.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain:
- Much/ a little: uncountable noun. 
- Few/a few/many/a large number of: countable noun.

total_grammar_preinter14.question: They ________ in New York next week.
This is the best performance of Hamlet that I ________ in years.
They ________ that you are going to be late.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain: - Simple present tense: expresses general fact.

total_grammar_preinter14.question: The people that I ________ here have been very friendly.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain: - Simple Past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past. Sometimes, the speaker may not actually mention the specific time, but they do have one specific time in mind.

total_grammar_preinter14.question: The plug has come out of the ________.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain: - Socket: the place on a piece of electrical equipment that you put a plug or a light bulb into.

total_grammar_preinter14.question: She says that she ________ the bill next week.
total_grammar_preinter14.explain:
- Simple future tense. 
"Will" is usually used in promises.

total_grammar_preinter15.question: That is the best book that I ________ on that subject.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain: - Present perfect tense: You can use the Present Perfect to describe your experience (the first/the most...that...).

total_grammar_preinter15.question: Yesterday I met the woman who ________ us with the work next month.
That ________ the best movie that I had seen for a long time.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain: - Past perfect tense: expresses the idea that something occurred before another action in the past- first clause should be simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter15.question: He said that he ________ me there at 4.30 this afternoon.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain:
- In reported speech: 
+ If the reporting verb (i.e. said) is in the past, the reported clause will be in a past form. This form is usually one step back into the past from the original. 
+ If simple present, present perfect or the future is used in the reporting verb (i.e. says) the tense is retained. 
+ If reporting a general truth the present tense will be retained or even the future tense can be used.

total_grammar_preinter15.question: Maxwell ________ three dollars for the tie he bought at Macy's.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain: - Bought: shows that this is simple past tense- .... is simple past tense, too.

total_grammar_preinter15.question: The salesman was telling me that he ________ ten cars last week.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain:
- In reported speech: 
+ If the reporting verb (i.e. said) is in the past, the reported clause will be in a past form. This form is usually one step back into the past from the original. 
+ If simple present, present perfect or the future is used in the reporting verb (i.e. says) the tense is retained. 
+ If reporting a general truth the present tense will be retained or even the future tense can be used.

total_grammar_preinter15.question: Did Bob say that he ________ from Princeton in 1951?
total_grammar_preinter15.explain:
- In reported speech: 
+ If the reporting verb (i.e. said) is in the past, the reported clause will be in a past form. This form is usually one step back into the past from the original. 
+ If simple present, present perfect or the future is used in the reporting verb (i.e. says) the tense is retained. 
+ If reporting a general truth the present tense will be retained or even the future tense can be used.

total_grammar_preinter15.question: We bought a used car that had belonged to an old couple who used the car only when they ________ shopping.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain: - Used: shows that this is simple past tense- .... is simple past tense, too.

total_grammar_preinter15.question: The man who will replace Mr. Stuart ________ yesterday.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain: - Simple Past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (yesterday).

total_grammar_preinter15.question: We thought that they ________ to Arizona yesterday.
total_grammar_preinter15.explain: - Simple past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (yesterday).

total_grammar_preinter16.question: We'll wait until she ________.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - Future present tense until + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter16.question: Call Jack as soon as you ________ in town.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain:
- Future present tense until /when/as soon as+ simple present tense. 
- This sentence implies future tense.

total_grammar_preinter16.question: He knows he has ________ when he is asked to appear on TV.
I'll think about your suggestion while I ________ for you.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - Simple present tense/future tense + while + simple present continuous.

total_grammar_preinter16.question: Before Jack leaves New York, he ________ several new plays.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - Present perfect tense: We use the Present Perfect to say that an action happened at an unspecified time before now.

total_grammar_preinter16.question: They will be very happy when they ________ the news.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - Future present tense until /when/as soon as+ simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter16.question: I always ________ better after I have rested a while.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - Simple present tense: Use the Simple Present to express the idea that an action is repeated or usual (always).

total_grammar_preinter16.question: We will have learned many new words before we ________ through this course.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - Future present tense until /when/as soon as/ before + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter16.question: It is two o'clock, and I ________ my homework yet.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - Present perfect tense: We often use the Present Perfect to say that an action which we expected has not happened. Using the Present Perfect suggests that we are still waiting for the action to happen.

total_grammar_preinter16.question: We usually go out to dinner when we ________ late.
total_grammar_preinter16.explain: - By the time/when + present perfect/simple present tense, simple future tense.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: She will be ready when he ________ here.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - Simple present tense/future tense + while/when + simple present continuous/simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: The child always cries when his mother ________ out of the house.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - Simple present tense/future tense + while/when + simple present continuous/simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: They often listen to the radio while they ________ in their car.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - Simple present tense/future tense + while/when + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: We saw several old friends while we ________ in Baltimore.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - Simple past tense/past perfect tense + while/when + simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: Raymond ________ two new shirts when he was downtown today.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain:
- Simple past tense/past perfect tense + while/when + simple past tense. 
- This case " simple pass tense " is more reasonable.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: After we had had breakfast, we ________ the house.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - After + past perfect tense, simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: I had heard the news before you ________ me about it.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - Past perfect tense+ before + simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: It ________ when I got up this morning.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - When + Simple past tense, simple past continuous.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: Mary was not feeling well when she ________ down yesterday.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: - When + Simple past tense, simple past continuous.

total_grammar_preinter17.question: He signed the contract after he ________ each statement carefully.
total_grammar_preinter17.explain: -After + past perfect tense, simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: Jim had just turned out the lights when the doorbell ________.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - Simple past tense/past perfect tense + while/when + simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: I work so hard that I ________ tired.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - I work so hard: simple present tense- result (tired) must be in simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: I'll return the books to the library if I ________ time.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - Condition type I: If + simple present, simple future tense/simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: Richard left dirty footmarks wherever he ________.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - Richard left dirty footmarks: is simple past tense- wherever he __________ must be simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: I worked so hard that I ________ tired.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - I worked so hard : is simple past tense- I __________ tired: must be simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: Don't handle those cups and saucers as if they ________ made of iron.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain:
- Clauses that start with as if/as though express unreality, improbability or doubt if they are followed by an unreal tense. 
- The simple past tense is used if we talk about an unreal situation in the present.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: I am standing where I ________ the game.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain:
- Where I __________ the game: Is the purpose of action "I am standing"= Where I __________ the game: must be in present tense. 
- This sentence imply that the speaker wants to see the game (positive).

total_grammar_preinter18.question: Use the paint-brush as I ________ you yesterday.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - Simple past tense: Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (yesterday).

total_grammar_preinter18.question: Everywhere I ________ there were dirty footmarks.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - There were dirty footmarks: simple present tense- Everywhere I ________ must be in simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter18.question: We couldn't play the match because the frog ________ too thick.
total_grammar_preinter18.explain: - The frog ________ too thick: Is the cause of action "We couldn't play the match " (simple past)= the frog ________ too thick:must be in simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter19.question: We shall come and see you if we ________ a holiday.
total_grammar_preinter19.explain: - Condition type I: If + simple present, simple future tense/simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter19.question: Their mother often suggests ________ with some friends.
total_grammar_preinter19.explain:
- Suggest doing something. 
- Do not say.

total_grammar_preinter19.question: I don't feel like ________ for a walk now.
I'm sorry, I can't remember ________ her last week.
total_grammar_preinter19.explain: - Remember+ V_ing: Remember something which have already happened/done.

total_grammar_preinter19.question: Now, I think she is accustomed ________ eight hours a day.
total_grammar_preinter19.explain: - Be accustomed to (doing) something to be familiar with something and accept it as normal.

total_grammar_preinter19.question: The fabric is ________ a material which catch fire easily.
total_grammar_preinter19.explain: - To be made of + a type of material.

total_grammar_preinter20.question: There were signs everywhere ________ people to keep out of the grass in the park.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain: That's right! You chose the correct response.

total_grammar_preinter20.question: It is very difficult ________ a twin from the other.
He is agreeable ________ to Nam's proposal.
There are so many signs along that road ________ down because that road is very slippery.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain: - We use present particle to shorten the relative clause

total_grammar_preinter20.question: Each of these sounds ________ me sleepy.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain:
- Simple present tense. 
- Subject (Each of these sounds ) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter20.question: Either Mike or his friends ________ going to the beach today.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain: - If you use either-or/ neither-nor/not only- but also: look at the subject closest to the verb. If the subject closest to the verb is singular, use a singular verb; likewise, if the subject is plural, use a plural verb.

total_grammar_preinter20.question: Everyone in the class ________ the novel.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain: - The pronouns each, everyone, every one, everybody, anyone, anybody, someone, and somebody are singular and require singular verbs.

total_grammar_preinter20.question: He often ________ his dog when he comes home.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain:
- Simple present tense: express a habit (often). 
- Subject (he) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter20.question: One of the golf clubs ________ in the corner of the room at this moment.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain:
- Present Continuous: 
+Express the idea that something is happening now (at this moment).

total_grammar_preinter20.question: Mary is doing her homework and ________ brother is helping her.
total_grammar_preinter20.explain: - Her: used as a possessive determiner followed by a noun

total_grammar_preinter21.question: One of the rooms ________ an air conditioner.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
- Simple present tense: express general fact. 
- Subject (one of) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: Everyone of the clerks ________ punch the time clock.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain: - The pronouns each, everyone, every one, everybody, anyone, anybody, someone, and somebody are singular and require singular verbs.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: Each of his assistants ________ the telephone.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
- Simple present tense: express general fact. 
- The pronouns each, everyone, every one, everybody, anyone, anybody, someone, and somebody are singular and require singular verbs.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: Each of the girls ________ the piano.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
- Simple present tense: express general fact. 
- The pronouns each, everyone, every one, everybody, anyone, anybody, someone, and somebody are singular and require singular verbs.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: I wonder why the English ________ on the left hand side of the road.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain: - The: used before an adjective to make it into a plural noun when you are referring to all the people that the adjective describes.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: He ________ the custom was grounded in good sense.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
In reported speech: 
+ If the reporting verb (i.e. said) is in the past, the reported clause will be in a past form. This form is usually one step back into the past from the original.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: A horse ________ always mounted from the left.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
- Simple present tense: express a habit (often). 
- Subject (a horse) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: There ________ no rule about the movement of traffic before the Pope came to visit Paris.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
- Simple past tense. 
- There is/was (= have): used when object is singular or uncountable noun. 
- There are/were (= have): used when object is plural noun.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: Thus a custom ________ born.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
- We often say "was/were + born". 
- Subject (a custom) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter21.question: There ________ only one place in the whole of England where it ________ legal to drive on the right.
total_grammar_preinter21.explain:
- Simple present tense. 
- There is/ There are: real subject is after "to be (is, are...)"- only one place is real subject in this case-= to be- is.

total_grammar_preinter22.question: The founders of the American nature ________ the custom after the Revolution.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain:
- Simple Past: 
+ Express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (after the Revolution).

total_grammar_preinter22.question: When Bonaparte came along, he ________ it the law of the land.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - The Simple Past used with a duration which starts and stops in the past (When Bonaparte came along).

total_grammar_preinter22.question: The king just ________ here yesterday.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (yesterday).

total_grammar_preinter22.question: Many people ________ their jobs because of the firm's collapse.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - We use the past simple tense to express the idea that an action started and finished in the past

total_grammar_preinter22.question: I ________ cleaning the floor, and now it's dirty again.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain:
Present Perfect: 
+ Express action happened at an unspecified time before now. This tense emphasis the completion or result.

total_grammar_preinter22.question: I ________ a ghost in my life.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - Present perfect tense: used to describe your experience (the first/the most...that; never, ever...).

total_grammar_preinter22.question: They ________ dinner before coming here.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - We use past perfect to show that something happened before a specific time in the past.

total_grammar_preinter22.question: He waked up and down until he ________ by the returning warmth.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - Until + simple past, Past Perfect/simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter22.question: I will wait until you ________ back.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - Future present tense until /when/as soon as/ before + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter22.question: We always take out umbrellas with us when it ________.
total_grammar_preinter22.explain: - Two clauses are in present simple tense

total_grammar_preinter23.question: I sat near the window whenever I ________ a bus.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - When the main clause is in past tense, in the subordinate clause the past tense shows another completed action related in time to the main action.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: It was raining hard when I ________ there.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - When + Simple past tense, simple past continuous.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: She ________ the piano since she was a child.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain:
- Present Perfect: 
+ Express action happened at an unspecified time before now. The exact time is not important. 
+ Unspecific expressions: since, never, once, many times, several times, before, so far,yet, just, for.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: The sun ________ in the east.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain:
- Simple present tense: expresses event that is always true. 
- Subject (the sun) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: How long do you want me to heat the oil? Heat it till it ________ to smoke.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - Future present tense/simple present tense until/till /when/as soon as/ before + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: How long are you going to stay here? - I'm going to stay here till my brother ________ his exams.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - Future present tense/simple present tense until/till /when/as soon as/ before + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: When will you start the trip? - We'll leave as soon as we ________ our tickets.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - Future present tense/simple present tense until/till /when/as soon as/ before + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: I'm learning English. Well, when we ________ English fluently, we may find a good job.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - Simple present tense/future tense + while/when + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: By the time you ________ this book, your meal will get cold. - Oh, I only have a few pages left.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - By the time/when + present perfect, simple future tense.

total_grammar_preinter23.question: Are you taking English courses? - Yes, and my teacher says that when I ________ five courses, I shall be able to speak it quite fluently.
total_grammar_preinter23.explain: - By the time/when + present perfect, simple future tense.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: Is your father at home? - No, he is away on business. If you have a message for him, I ________ it to him as soon as he ________ home.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Condition type I: If + simple present, simple future tense/simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: Please tell me how to get to the post office? - Go till you ________ to a square with a statue in the middle; then turn left and you ________ it on your right.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Future present tense/simple present + until/till /when/as soon as/ before + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: What did he say before he left for Paris? - He said he would give me a ring as soon as he ________ Paris.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Simple past tense/future tense in the past+ until/till /when/as soon as/ before + simple past tense tense.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: I thought you were going to the concert. - I was. But when I got there, the tickets ________ sold out. So I ________ go back home.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain:
- When + Simple past tense, simple past continuous/past perfect tense. 
- The whole sentence is past tense- second blank (So I ........... go back home) is in the past tense.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: How long have you been working in this firm? - I have been working here for five years. When I ________ here for fifteen years, I'll be able to get some pension.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Simple present tense/future tense + while/when + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: Tell us what ________ to you yesterday?
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (yesterday).

total_grammar_preinter24.question: We ________ you a telegram as soon as we ________ in Chicago tomorrow.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Future present tense/simple present + until/till /when/as soon as/ before + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: The druggist ________ for home when we ________ to the store yesterday.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - We use the past perfect to express the idea that something occurred before another action in the past.

total_grammar_preinter24.question: Mr. Carlson ________ to another man when I ________ him this morning.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Clause (past continuous) when Clause (past simple): when you say that something happened in the middle of something else in the past

total_grammar_preinter24.question: I ________ Mr. Harris your message when I see him tomorrow.
total_grammar_preinter24.explain: - Future tense/simple present tense + while/when + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter25.question: When George ________ this afternoon, he ________ his friends.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - Future tense/simple present tense + while/when + simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter25.question: The Andersons ________ into their new apartment last week.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - Use the Simple Past to express the idea that an action started and finished at a specific time in the past (last week).

total_grammar_preinter25.question: As I ________ the street, two cars ________ by me at full speed yesterday.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - When/As + Simple past tense, simple past continuous/past perfect tense (this case is simple past continuous).

total_grammar_preinter25.question: Mr. Brink ________ the Atlantic by the time the news reaches him.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - By the time/when + simple present tense , simple future continuous

total_grammar_preinter25.question: If we ________ the news sooner, we would have written to John.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - Conditional sentence type 3: If + past perfect, would/could/should + have + PP.

total_grammar_preinter25.question: I'm sure they ________ Ellen the information if they had it.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - Conditional sentence type 2: If + simple past tense, would/could/should + Verb.

total_grammar_preinter25.question: If a policeman ________ an accident, he will take the driver's name.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain:
- Condition type I: If + simple present, simple future tense/simple present tense. 
- Subject (a policeman) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter25.question: We are going to buy the furniture if we ________ some money.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - Condition type I: If + simple present, simple future tense/simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter25.question: What ________ tomorrow if you ________ a millionaire?
total_grammar_preinter25.a: are you going to do / are
total_grammar_preinter25.b: were you doing to do / was
total_grammar_preinter25.explain: - Conditional sentence type 2: If + simple past tense, would/could/should + Verb.

total_grammar_preinter25.question: If Carl ________ so careless, he wouldn't lose his good job.
total_grammar_preinter25.explain:
- Conditional sentence type 2: If + simple past tense, would/could/should + Verb. 
-  To be - were (whatever the subject is singular or plural).

total_grammar_preinter26.question: If you ________ the instruction, read them again.
total_grammar_preinter26.explain: - Condition type I: If + simple present, simple future tense

total_grammar_preinter26.question: I ________ it unless I had seen it with my own eyes.
total_grammar_preinter26.explain:
- Unless can use in conditional sentence likes "if": 
- Type 3: Would/could/should + have+ pp, unless + Past perfect.

total_grammar_preinter26.question: Fred ________ it unless he had your permission.
total_grammar_preinter26.explain:
- Unless can use in conditional sentence likes "if": 
- Type 2: Would/could/should + Verb, unless + simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter26.question: I ________ that job even if the manager offers it to me.
total_grammar_preinter26.explain: - Conditional  type I: If + simple present, simple future tense/simple present tense.

total_grammar_preinter26.question: I was reluctant ________ a decision without ________ all the facts.
total_grammar_preinter26.explain:
- It's adj + To Verb.
- Without + noun/verb-ing.

total_grammar_preinter26.question: The man was accused of ________ private property.
After we ________ all our exercises, we went to the cinema.
total_grammar_preinter26.explain: - After + past perfect tense, simple past tense.

total_grammar_preinter26.question: None of us ________ such a delicious meal like this.
total_grammar_preinter26.explain:
- Present simple tense: express general fact. 
- Subject (none of) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter26.question: The country is very ________, so travelling on the road is difficult.
The teacher streaked the need for regular ________.

total_grammar_preinter27.question: John's ________ improved at his new school.
total_grammar_preinter27.explain: - After possessive form ('s) is a noun.

total_grammar_preinter27.question: Jim always does what he says; he's a very ________ person.
The company is very efficient and gives a ________ service.
Since ________ has been so poor, the class has to be closed.
total_grammar_preinter27.explain:
- Subject is often noun/pronoun. 
- Attendance: the number of people attend a meeting/class...

total_grammar_preinter27.question: Do you have a ________ costume in your country?
total_grammar_preinter27.explain:
- A + adj + noun (noun phrase). 
- Native : is place smaller than national.

total_grammar_preinter27.question: The weather will be better with ________ showers.
I had no map. That's why I got lost. If I ________ a map, I ________ all right.
total_grammar_preinter27.explain: - Conditional sentence type 3: If + past perfect, would/could/should + have + PP.

total_grammar_preinter27.question: Most people ________ the Union meeting if they had had longer notice of it.
total_grammar_preinter27.explain: - Conditional sentence type 3: If + past perfect, would/could/should + have + PP.

total_grammar_preinter27.question: The boy with his dog ________ here last night.
total_grammar_preinter27.explain: -The phrase introduced by as well as or along with will modify the earlier word (the boy).

total_grammar_preinter28.question: Each of the boy ________ won a prize.
total_grammar_preinter28.explain:
- Present Perfect: 
+ Express action happened at an unspecified time before now. The exact time is not important. 
- The pronouns each, everyone, every one, everybody, anyone, anybody, someone, and somebody are singular and require singular verbs. Do not be misled by what follows of.

total_grammar_preinter28.question: He's got a lot of books ________.
I heard the door ________.
total_grammar_preinter28.explain:
- Find/ see/ watch/hear...+ Verb (with to) :you find /see or watch the whole action. 
- Find/ see/ watch/hear...+ Verb_ing : you find /see or watch part of the action.

total_grammar_preinter28.question: In your office, who is responsible for ________ the mail?
There is ________ to believe that he is not prepared for his future work.
This company offers a lot of ________ jobs.
total_grammar_preinter28.explain: - Adj + Noun: adj often used to modify noun.

total_grammar_preinter28.question: The farmers need ________ their crops.
total_grammar_preinter28.explain:
- Need + To be Past Participle/ V_ing: if before "need" is not person. 
- Need + To Verb: If before "need" is person.

total_grammar_preinter28.question: A new road is being ________ in my village.
total_grammar_preinter28.explain: - Present continuous + passive voice: be + being + PP.

total_grammar_preinter28.question: When the wastes are poured into the atmosphere, the air ________ unpleasant to breathe.
total_grammar_preinter28.explain:
- Future tense/simple present tense + while/when + simple present tense. 
- Subject (the air) is singular.

total_grammar_preinter28.question: Now farmers are accustomed ________ this fertilizer to their fields.
total_grammar_preinter28.explain: - To be accustomed to doing something: to be familiar with something and accept it as normal.

total_grammar_preinter29.question: Well, I think that the prices here are ________.
Do you feel ________ to this kind of job?
total_grammar_preinter29.explain:
- Feel/smell/ taste...+ adj. 
- Someone feel attracted to sth. 
- Something is attractive to sbd.

total_grammar_preinter29.question: American women ________ independent.
total_grammar_preinter29.explain: - Be used to Verb-ing: be familiar with sth.

total_grammar_preinter29.question: Which would you ________, tea or coffee?
They are ________ doing the same thing every day.
total_grammar_preinter29.explain: - Doing the same thing that often leads to boredom.

total_grammar_preinter29.question: Ask the shop ________ where the washing powder is.
total_grammar_preinter29.explain: - Shop assistant: the sale-person in shop.

total_grammar_preinter29.question: If my tooth doesn't stop hurting. I'll go and see my ________.
total_grammar_preinter29.explain: - Dentist: a doctor who cares of tooth.

total_grammar_preinter29.question: Not many buses have a ________ You usually pay the driver.
total_grammar_preinter29.explain: - Conductor: someone who collect payment from passenger on a bus.

total_grammar_preinter29.question: Look! The ________ is feeding the lions.
total_grammar_preinter29.explain: - Keeper: someone who looks after animals.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: She is an ________ girl.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain:
- Someone feels attracted to sth/someone.
- Something/someone is attractive to sbd.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: After your eye test, the ________ will tell you if you need glasses.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain: - The optician: someone who tests people's eyes and sells glasses.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: The ________ wanted to write an article about me in the paper.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain: - The journalist: someone who writes news, report for newspaper, magazine.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: I hope the ________ can repair our car quickly.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain: - The mechanic: someone who skills at repairing vehicles.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: He got drunk after drinking some ________ drink.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain: - Strong drink: having taste or small that you notice easily.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: The ________ of the moon for the earth causes the tides.
He was ________ right when he said that the man was guilty.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain:
- Adverb can modify adjective. 
Adv + adj.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: Another word for "damage" is ________.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain: - Destruction has the same meaning with damage.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: 'To employ' means to ________.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain: - Hire= to be employed by somebody.

total_grammar_preinter30.question: Another word for "entire" is ________.
total_grammar_preinter30.explain: - Entire: used when you want to emphasize that you mean all of a group, period of time, amount etc [= whole].
